resources.string: Have you see Watcher Guerra anywhere? It's unlike Tony to be ranging about for so long.\n\nHe's probably out helping some traveler on the road…
What am I going to do without Tony? He was my strength, my courage. \n\nIf he's become Lost, then perhaps it would be better for everyone if I let go as well…

Tony's spyglass is a reminder of the man he was, the man he always tried to be.\n\nI've been reading his journal, and I understand now why he became so demoralized - the Lost are rallying to destroy us.
I'm afraid that Musslebeard is not the last of our problems here in Mourningdale.\n\nGildon came to see me, and she warned of an even greater threat, already at our doorstep.
Though I dearly miss Antonio, you've given me the strength to carry on.\n\nTony would be proud of us both, I think.
None of these plants and potions feel like they'll do any good for Gildon… \n\nWhat to do…

Tincture of Rotroot? No... Tea of Wyrdwood Bark? No... none of these remedies would work, I…\n\nOh, forgive me! I didn't see you there. If you've come to Mourningdale, you may have noticed the terrible state we're in.
Ah, there you are! I was hoping you might return!\n\nIn my concern and haste for the welfare of Gildon and the Magistrate, I quite forgot my own concerns.

As mad as it may seem to contemplate such things, I've started to think differently about the Lost.\n\nPerhaps it's not life that's so difficult, but rather the soul part that's riddled with conflict.
The forge and all the other workshops here are the lifeblood of Mourningdale.\n\nWithout craftsmanship and trade, we'd all starve to death.
Mark my words - all the mewling over Watcher Guerra and the paranoia about the Corruption, it's killing trade.\n\nWhat we should really fear is whether we wind up going hungry next year!
Our arrangement has the makings of what could be quite a profitable partnership.\n\nI just realized, I never properly introduced myself. Artificer, Bartle Wrightson… and you are?
I hope you won't be a stranger around here, {playerName}. \n\nI am always looking for mutualy beneficial business partnerships. It's good for everyone.
I see you, traveler, and I see a long journey, both behind and ahead. \n\nChallenges faced and to be faced; all better not to be spoken of.
My mind won't still. Thoughts race by, too quick to grasp. \n\nFor the first since I can remember, the mundane is more tangible than the fantastic.
Ah, it's good to see you again, with all my senses now, hazed as they may be. \n\nYes, my second-sight returns, but it remains weak, and I need your help to restore it.
Truths from the past may be buried, drowned, and long forgotten, but they remain.\n\nEternal life is the law of Aeternum, but truth is even more permanent.
At last, with your help, my sight approaches its previous strength, but it is not enough. \n\nMy visions as they came before cannot penetrate that which now approaches…
My visions are clear, and I'm able to advise these people once more. I've seen into my own past, the past of the island, and its truths guide us.\n\nLet them guide you, too.
When it rains, it pours. No sooner did Shattered Mountain erupt than we started having all manner of trouble.\n\nI have to wonder if it's not all emotional, but that doesn't help anyone, does it?
Stay a while, friend. Even in the hard times, we must take care of ourselves.\n\nDon't get too hungry, angry, lonely, or tired… or you might make a mistake.
If you know what's good for ya, you'll pack it in.
Flippin' 'eck. Aren't you a sight for these paggered eyes! What do you need?

Flippin' 'eck. Aren't you a sight for these paggered eyes! What do you need?



[ Level 43 required for Mourningdale faction missions ]
You think you're so clever. Well you ain't seen nowt what I have.
Oh spare me your guff. If you'd seen the horrors of war I have, you'd quit the preaching and shut ya pie hole.
Oh wait, I almost have this solved. Golly, you are a nuisance, aren't you? Oh, hello.
At last! Someone with the acumen to comprehend my genius. Oh, did you need something, Sweetie?

At last! Someone with the acumen to comprehend my genius. Oh, did you need something, Sweetie?



[ Level 43 required for Mourningdale faction missions ]
I would comment on your lack of… a certain something between the ears, but that's wouldn't be proper, now would it?
I am so close to unveiling the scret to Azoth. Oh, what was it again? You cultists always appear at the wrong time…which is any time, really.

Mourningdale can be a dour place, but there is opportunity here for the inquisitive.\n\nLike you, {playerName}. Your work with Krockes is quite famous, and now you are ready to advance in rank once again?

Mourningdale can be a dour place, but there is opportunity here for the inquisitive.

Like you, {playerName}. Your work with Krockes is quite famous, and now you are ready to advance in rank once again?



[ Level 43 required for Mourningdale faction missions ]
I predict these Psychokinetic Trace Absorbers will be literally full of traces soon.\n\nImagine what we can learn!

I predict these Psychokinetic Trace Absorbers will be literally full of traces soon.

Imagine what we can learn!



[ Level 43 required for Mourningdale faction missions ]
When you are prepared to embrace the truth, the Covenant will be here.
Welcome, friend. I am here to serve our followers here in Mourningdale. Light the way.

Welcome, friend. I am here to serve our followers here in Mourningdale. Light the way.



[ Level 43 required for Mourningdale faction missions ]
Savage. I believe you must be lost, yes? I am here to share the light, but you are cast in shadow.
With your nose buried in books all the time, your eyes have become accustomed to the darkness. \n\nI hope you someday emerge into the light!
Welcome to Lam's Retreat. This is the best place to stay when enjoying the azoth-infused streams here in Mourningdale.
I'm Master Fisher Abebe of Mourningdale. I can train you in the ways of fishing.
I'm Master Fisher Abebe of Mourningdale. I can train you in the ways of fishing.
Greetings, friend. May your casts be far and your hook be true.
